name: zeus
content:

in Greek mythology (= ancient stories), the greatest of the gods, the god of the sky and the weather, who ruled over human beings and the other gods: Before Zeus hurled his first thunderbolt from Olympus, the pre-Greek people occupying the land presumably offered sacrifices to their own gods and goddesses. See also
Jupiter
More examplesFewer examples The founding legend of the Olympic Games was depicted on the east pediment of the temple of Zeus at Olympia. To the north rises a conical hill, bristling with pine forest, where, according to legend, Zeus wrestled his father, the Titan Kronos, for control of the world.In Greek mythology Zeus impregnated Danae in the form of golden rain.Prometheus knows Zeus will be overthrown by one of his own sons, and Zeus is desperate to know which one.
